sentences.en: Denim was also worn with tweed or a dash of evening attire.
sentences.cn: 粗斜棉布衣服同样可以跟粗花呢衣服配套穿着,或是配上一件小巧的晚装.

sentences.en: He was wearing a tweed suit that looked tailor-made.
sentences.cn: 他身穿一套粗花呢西服，看上去像是量身定做的。
他穿一件粗花呢夹克衫.

sentences.en: He wore a tweed sports jacket.
sentences.cn: 他穿了一件粗花呢运动夹克.

sentences.en: I am so pleased to make your acquaintance, Mr Tweed.
sentences.cn: 很高兴认识您，特威德先生。

sentences.en: I bought a skirt length of tweed.
sentences.cn: 我买了一段够做一条裙子的花呢料.

sentences.en: I was wearing my tweed suit.
In late July 1914, he and Violet spent a few days with friends near Berwick-upon-Tweed.
sentences.cn: 1914年7月下旬，他和维奥莱特与几个朋友在特威德河畔贝里克附近度过了几天。

sentences.en: It is doubtful whether Tweed, even with his fluent French, passed for one of the locals.
sentences.cn: 尽管特威德能说一口流利的法语，他是否能被当作当地人还很难说。

sentences.en: Martha was wearing a heavy tweed coat.
sentences.cn: 玛莎穿着一件花呢厚大衣.

sentences.en: Never wear tweed coat and flannel trousers.
sentences.cn: 千万不要穿花呢上衣配法兰绒裤.

sentences.en: The tweed jacket she wore had seen better days.
sentences.cn: 她穿的那件粗花呢夹克已经很旧了。

sentences.en: Tweed is timeless, tactile and tough.
sentences.cn: 粗花呢从不过时，手感很好，结实耐磨。

sentences.en: Tweed ordered a carafe of the house wine.
sentences.cn: 特威德点了一瓶佐餐葡萄酒。

sentences.en: Tweed walked at a leisurely pace.

words.tran_cn: 松散悠闲的；穿花呢服的；男子气概的；好游乐的

trans.tran_en: rough  woollen  cloth woven from threads of different colours, used mostly to make  jackets  , suits, and coats
